abstract.text: The production of quarkonium is an important testing ground for QCD calculations.
The J/ψ and Υ production cross-sections are measured in proton-proton collisions at a centre-of-mass energy of 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector at the LHC.
Differential cross-sections are presented as a function of transverse momentum and rapidity.
The fraction of J/ψ produced in B-hadron decays is also measured and the differential cross-sections of prompt and non-prompt J/ψ production determined separately.
Measurements of the fiducial production crosssection of the Υ(1S) and observation of the χ c,bJ states are also discussed.

body_text.text: Introduction
Quarkonia are formed from a quark pair of same flavour and should represent one of the simplest systems described by QCD theory.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Heavy quarkonium is a multiscale system, allowing for rigorous tests of the interplay between perturbative and non-perturbative QCD and a rich spectrum of radial and orbital excitations allow studies of spectroscopy and decay dynamics [1].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: In addition, quarkonia is an ideal probe of cold and hot nuclear matter effects [2].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Many open questions exist in this area, and it has proven difficult thus far to universally describe the kinematics and production properties of quarkonia.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: ATLAS plans to investigate quarkonium production through measurements of production, spin-alignment and associated hadronic activity of these various states.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: The first production measurements toward this goal are outlined below.

body_text.text: Prompt Υ(1S) fiducial production cross-section measurement
Measurement of the Υ(1S ) cross-section has been conducted in a similar manner as with J/ψ, also using single muon triggers.

body_text.text: In contrast to the J/ψ results, this measurement is presented in a fiducial region: p µ T > 4 GeV, |η µ | < 2.5 to remove the uncertainty due to spin alignment in the cross-section measurement.

body_text.text: Reconstruction of χ cJ mesons through radiative decays
The χ c1 and χ c2 mesons in radiative decays to a J/ψ and a photon have been observed via calorimetry.
body_text.section: Reconstruction of χ cJ mesons through radiative decays

body_text.text: Measuring the production cross-sections of the χ cJ are crucial for precise understanding of J/ψ production and acts as a test of pQCD in its own right.
body_text.section: Reconstruction of χ cJ mesons through radiative decays

body_text.text: Photons at ATLAS can also be identified and measured through reconstruction of the tracks from electron-position pairs associated with a photon conversion occurring in the Inner Detector.
body_text.section: Reconstruction of χ cJ mesons through radiative decays

body_text.text: The tracking capabilities of ATLAS allow for much more precise measurement of the photon kine-matics through this method, but is balanced by a low probability for a conversion to occur and successfully be reconstructed.
body_text.section: Reconstruction of χ cJ mesons through radiative decays
